category.name: phone
category.comment: This is the static phone category. It cannot be changed or removed

posture.comment: This is an "at rest" symbol that is used to start and terminate utterances without introducing ridiculous transitions etc!
This is an "at rest" symbol that is used to start and terminate utterances without introducing ridiculous transitions etc!
This primed version was shortened since the original data was statistically invalid (too few samples). We simply substituted the durations from uh'.
Bumped qss values up to 30 from 14
We have fiddled the duration by plus 20 msec because the very short qss was causing impulse problems in paramater construction.
We have doubled the qss's because uu tends to get underestimated as it is often final and dies away.

We have increased the qss's because uu tends to get underestimated as it is often final and dies away. The "'" version is longer in proportion to the not-' version by rough comparison with other vowels. Yes!!! This is *very* ad hoc and Len disapproves!

equation.name: TriphoneDefault
equation.formula: (qssb1 / tempo1) + (transition2 + qssa2 + qssb2) / tempo2 + (transition3 + qssa3) / tempo3

equation.name: TetraphoneDefault
equation.formula: (qssb1 / tempo1) + (transition2 + qssa2 + qssb2) / tempo2 + (transition3 + qssa3 + qssb3) / tempo3 + (transition4 + qssa4) / tempo4

equation.name: Mark2
equation.formula: (qssb1 / tempo1) + (transition2 + qssa2 + qssb2) / tempo2 + (transition3 + qssa3) / tempo3

equation.name: endOfVLessAspBurst
equation.comment:
This is the one we are always looking for!!
Namely rd - (qssa3/2)/tempo3

equation.name: VStopVTotalDur
equation.formula: qssb1 / tempo1 + ((transition2 * 2.000000) + qssa2 + qssb2) / tempo2 + qssa3 / tempo3

equation.name: vlessStopBurstTopA
equation.formula: qssb1 / tempo1 + (transition2 + qssa2 + qssb2 + (0.250000 * transition2)) / tempo2

equation.name: vlessStopBurstTopB
equation.formula: qssb1 / tempo1 + (transition2 + qssa2 + qssb2 + (0.500000 * transition2)) / tempo2

equation.name: vlessStopBurstTopC
equation.formula: qssb1 / tempo1 + (transition2 + qssa2 + qssb2 + (0.900000 * transition2)) / tempo2

transition.name: NullTriphone
transition.comment:
This is a simple straight line. In practice, and smoothly blended null transition is likely to be better if the end targets may vary throughout a string of postures.
A smoothly fitted null triphone is to be found as "StopGlide" under "Carre".

transition.name: voicedStopClosure
transition.comment: This is the same timing as the voicedStopClosure transition. Stop closure onset at qssb1, onset ends at qssb1 plus transition 2 (stop transition time). The closure offset begins atqssb1 plus transition2 plus qssa/b2, and ends at qssb1 plus qssa/b2 plus 2 * transition2

transition.name: dFinalGlotVol
transition.comment: This is the same timing as the voicedStopClosure transition. Stop closure onset at qssb1, onset ends at qssb1 plus transition 2 (stop transition time). The closure offset begins atqssb1 plus transition2 plus qssa/b2, and ends at qssb1 plus qssa/b2 plus 2 * transition2

transition.name: dFinalTongueClosure
transition.comment: This is the same timing as the voicedStopClosure transition. Stop closure onset at qssb1, onset ends at qssb1 plus transition 2 (stop transition time). The closure offset begins atqssb1 plus transition2 plus qssa/b2, and ends at qssb1 plus qssa/b2 plus 2 * transition2

transition.comment: This is the same timing as the voicedStopClosure transition. Stop closure onset at qssb1, onset ends at qssb1 plus transition 2 (stop transition time). The closure offset begins atqssb1 plus transition2 plus qssa/b2, and ends at qssb1 plus qssa/b2 plus 2 * transition2.

transition.name: dud14
transition.comment: This is the same timing as the voicedStopClosure transition. Stop closure onset at qssb1, onset ends at qssb1 plus transition 2 (stop transition time). The closure offset begins atqssb1 plus transition2 plus qssa/b2, and ends at qssb1 plus qssa/b2 plus 2 * transition2.

transition.comment: This is the same timing as the voicedStopClosure transition. Stop closure onset at qssb1, onset ends at qssb1 plus transition 2 (stop transition time). The closure offset begins atqssb1 plus transition2 plus qssa/b2, and ends at qssb1 plus qssa/b2 plus 2 * transition2

transition.comment: This is the same timing as the voicedStopClosure transition. Stop closure onset at qssb1, onset ends at qssb1 plus transition 2 (stop transition time). The closure offset begins atqssb1 plus transition2 plus qssa/b2, and ends at qssb1 plus qssa/b2 plus 2 * transition2

transition.comment: This is the same timing as the voicedStopClosure transition. Stop closure onset at qssb1, onset ends at qssb1 plus transition 2 (stop transition time). The closure offset begins atqssb1 plus transition2 plus qssa/b2, and ends at qssb1 plus qssa/b2 plus 2 * transition2

transition.name: StopToGlideAspBurst
transition.comment: This is only used for t going to l. t going to r uses tAspBurst.

rule.boolean-expression: ((vocoid or glide) or silence) >> m >> ((vocoid or glide) or silence)
(((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence) >> (b or bx) >> (((vocoid or nasal) or glide) or silence)
(((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence) >> (d or dx) >> (vocoid or nasal)
(((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence) >> (d or dx) >> ((r or rr) or (l or ll))
(((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence) >> (d or dx) >> silence
(((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence) >> g >> (((vocoid or nasal) or glide) or silence)
(((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence) >> (p or px) >> ((((vocoid or nasal) or silence) or y) or w)
(((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence) >> (p or px) >> (((r or rr) or l) or ll)
(((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence) >> (t or tx) >> ((((vocoid or nasal) or silence) or y) or w)
(((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence) >> (t or tx) >> (r or rr)
(((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence) >> (t or tx) >> (l or ll)
(((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence) >> (k or kx) >> ((((vocoid or nasal) or silence) or y) or w)
(((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence) >> (k or kx) >> (((r or rr) or l) or ll)
(((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence) >> (z or zh) >> silence
rule.comment: Note: this rtule must precede the rule for phone >> (s* or z*) >> phone so that devoicing final z gets handled correctly.

rule.boolean-expression: (((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence) >> (v or f) >> (((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence)
rule.comment: Note: This rule was split off from other fricatives because we get tongue radii co-articulation. We did not split voiced and voicless because Len agreed we couldn't hear the difference. Should maybe recombine other voiced & unvoiced fricatives under one rule again.

rule.boolean-expression: (((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence) >> (dh or th) >> (((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence)
rule.comment: Note: this rule must be preceded by the rule for phone >> z >> silence, so that devoicing inal z gets handled correctly.

rule.boolean-expression: (((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence) >> (fricative and voiced) >> (((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence)
rule.comment: Note: this rule must be preceded by the rule for phone >> z >> silence, so that devoicing inal z gets handled correctly.

rule.boolean-expression: (((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence) >> (fricative and (not voiced)) >> (((vocoid or glide) or nasal) or silence)
rule.comment: Note: FSee note for voiced Frics. plus this rule was created to allow a different form of microintonation for voiceless compared to voiced fricatvives.

rule.boolean-expression: silence >> hlike >> vocoid
phone >> hlike >> vocoid
(vocoid or glide) >> (vocoid or glide)
uh >> uu
uh' >> uu'
e >> i
o >> i
ah >> i
ah' >> i'
ah >> uu
ah' >> uu'
silence >> phone
phone >> silence
nasal >> phone
phone >> nasal
phone >> phone
